Posts.Content: LiG wrote: Diagnosed with DCIS about 2 cm last week.  These boards have really helped understand what is going on.  To begin with, I am 42 and single.  I saw my surgeon and a plastic surgeon yesterday and am now trying to review my choices.  Initial thought was lumpectomy followed by radiation; however, the surgeon informed me that the DCIS was located slightly below and to the edge of the aureola (upper portion) and that given how much tissue would be taken and the radiation treatment, it had a high chance of being disfiguring based on location.  He also told me that I was a good candidate for a nipple saving mastectomy which would have a better cosmetic effect and avoid radiation treatment as well as reduce my recurrence potential at about the same rate as above.  The plastic surgeon gave me all the mastectomy alternatives but agreed that the above was a good way to go but that I should be concerned with cancer treatment first and looks second.  He stated that doing any repair after radiation would be problematic due to the skin damage caused by the radiation.  I have been reading about both of these on the board here, but its hard to see the advantages of either.  Right now, I am in a nerve wracked. stomach turning dither on what to do...though I believe I am leaning toward the mastectomy.  Can anyone help me with how they made choices in simialr conditions and how it worked out? Dx 6/7/2009, DCIS, 3cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
